parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary interjection; as a sign of the vocative case, O; as a note of exclamation, oh.
Slow, slow of understanding. Of uncertain affinity; slow; figuratively, dull.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Plural

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
